title: Repository for PDF files
methodology_other: These resources are not datasets and therefore do not have a methodology.
name: repository-for-pdf-files
notes: This is a repository for PDF files that are linked on the OCHA Centre for Humanitarian Data's website, https://centre.humdata.org. Please note that if you wish to access these files, we recommend you use the Resources section of the Centre's website rather than downloading from HDX.
license_title: Creative Commons Attribution for Intergovernmental Organisations

organization.description: The Humanitarian Data Exchange (HDX) is an open data sharing platform managed by the United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs. The HDX organization is managed by the HDX data team and is used to share data on behalf of a number of partners
organization.title: HDX
organization.name: hdx

resources.description: This tip sheet offers a set of recommended actions for data security in humanitarian operations.
resources.name: Tip Sheet on Data Security in Operational Data Management.pdf

resources.description: The Centre conducted an independent review of the UCB Cider model, according to our Peer Review Framework. Cider is an open source toolkit developed by the Global Policy Lab at U.C. Berkeley for training models that use mobile phone data to infer poverty.
resources.name: Model Report - UCB Cider Model.pdf

resources.description: This tip sheet offers a set of recommended actions for data security in OCHA’s data management.
resources.name: Tip Sheet on Data Security in OCHA Data Management.pdf

resources.description: One-page handout on the Predictive Analytics workstream of the OCHA Centre for Humanitarian Data.
resources.name: Predictive Analytics handout - UN OCHA Centre Humdata.pdf

resources.description: Una descripción general de la divulgación estadística (SDC, por sus siglas en inglés), un método para evitar el riesgo de re-identificación al gestionar encuestas con información confidencial  y datos de evaluación de necesidades (microdatos).
resources.name: Guidance Note 1 Spanish.pdf

resources.description: Cómo abordar incidentes relacionados con la gestión de datos que han causado daño o tienen el potencial de causar daño.
resources.name: Guidance Note 2 Spanish.pdf

resources.description: Asesoramiento en el diseño de asociaciones responsables entre organizaciones humanitarias y el sector privado en iniciativas relacionadas con datos y tecnología.
resources.name: Guidance Note 3 Spanish.pdf

resources.description: Asesoramiento en el diseño de asociaciones responsables entre organizaciones humanitarias y el sector privado en iniciativas relacionadas con datos y tecnología.
resources.name: Guidance Note 4 Spanish.pdf

resources.description: Asesoramiento para trabajadores humanitarios sobre cómo decidir si realizar una evaluación del impacto de los datos, con ejemplos de herramientas de evaluación del impacto de los datos.
resources.name: Guidance Note 5 Spanish.pdf

resources.description: Una descripción general de los beneficios y riesgos comunes relacionados con los datos que enfrentan los actores del efectivo y un conjunto de acciones que pueden tomar para mejorar la responsabilidad de los datos.
resources.name: Guidance Note 6 Spanish.pdf

resources.description: Una descripción general de los objetivos y las limitaciones en torno al intercambio de datos confidenciales con los donantes y recomendaciones iniciales sobre cómo los donantes y las organizaciones humanitarias pueden compartir datos.
resources.name: Guidance Note 7 Spanish.pdf

resources.description: Ejemplos comunes de datos confidenciales no personales y un enfoque para la clasificación de la información y la confidencialidad de los datos para las organizaciones humanitarias.
resources.name: Guidance Note 8 Spanish.pdf

resources.description: The State of Open Humanitarian Data 2022 contains details on the data available for each location, category and sub-category covered in 27 Data Grids. It includes a country deep-dive for Somalia and showcases the work of the United Nations Population Fund on population statistics. It also has an assessment of the data required for modelling, specifically for developing anticipatory action trigger mechanisms, with examples from Ethiopia, Malawi, Nepal and the Philippines.
resources.name: State of Open Humanitarian Data 2022.pdf

resources.description: The goal of this report is to increase awareness of the data that is available to inform humanitarian operations around the world and to highlight what is missing, as measured through OCHA’s Humanitarian Data Exchange (HDX) platform. In a year dominated by the COVID-19 pandemic and its devastating impact on already-vulnerable populations, we saw record-breaking demand for data in the humanitarian sector coupled with persistent data gaps.
resources.name: State of Open Humanitarian Data 2021.pdf
